Messrs. Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin sought to play down any personality differences on Thursday. In an interview, Mr. Eric Schmidt said there had been no friction between the three that led to the change, and that they have been running particularly well in the last six or nine months because of this shared goal in efficiency. He added: "We actually agree on, I think, everything." The shake-up changes the face of one of the world's biggest tech companies and comes as a new generation of founder-CEOs has

February. Mr. Eric Schmidt has been Google's chief executive since July 2001, when he took over the role from Mr. Page and ushered the company through a public offering. Mr. Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects and new products, the company said. In a conference call, Mr. Eric Schmidt said the three had been making decisions together, but it was a slow process.
